headline: Assessing Bank Of America (BAC) Valuation After Recent Share Price Weakness
summary: With no single headline catalyst in focus, Bank of America (BAC) is drawing attention for its recent share performance, including a roughly 5% decline over the past month and a modest negative move over the past 3 months. See our latest analysis for Bank of America. At a share price of US$53.20, Bank of America’s recent 7 day share price return of 2.27% sits against a 30 day share price decline of 4.92%, while its 1 year total shareholder return of 17.79% and 5 year total shareholder return...

headline: Are You Looking for a High-Growth Dividend Stock?
summary: Dividends are one of the best benefits to being a shareholder, but finding a great dividend stock is no easy task. Does Bank of America (BAC) have what it takes? Let's find out.

headline: 3 reasons why BofA expects compute stocks to ’re-energize’
summary: Investing.com -- Bank of America expects compute-focused semiconductor stocks to regain momentum as artificial intelligence investment continues to accelerate, pointing to three key factors highlighted by hyperscalers.

headline: BofA indicator implies S&P 500 return of 12% over the next 12 months
summary: Investing.com -- Bank of America said its closely watched Sell Side Indicator (SSI) continues to point to solid equity gains ahead, with the gauge implying a 12 percent S&P 500 price return over the next year.

headline: TCM Group A/S: Major shareholder announcement
summary: COMPANY ANNOUNCEMENT No. 257/2026 Tvis, 2. February 2026 Major shareholder announcementWith reference to section 30 of the Danish Capital Markets Act, TCM Group A/S (the "Company") hereby announces that Bank of America Corporation has notified that, as of 29 January 2026, it has changed its holding of shares/voting rights and of other financial instruments acc. to section 39(2) of the Danish Capital Markets in TCM Group A/S as follows: Share capital and voting rightsHolding in TCM Group A/S prev

headline: Bank Of America Balances Epstein Lawsuit Risks With Stablecoin Policy Role
summary: A federal judge has allowed parts of a lawsuit to proceed that accuse Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) of being a "knowing beneficiary" of Jeffrey Epstein's alleged sex trafficking operation, while dismissing several other claims. Bank of America is also taking part in policy talks with Coinbase and the White House on possible rules for stablecoins and how digital assets could fit into mainstream banking. For you as an investor, these two threads pull in very different directions for Bank of...

headline: 3 Volatile Stocks Walking a Fine Line
summary: Market swings can be tough to stomach, and volatile stocks often experience exaggerated moves in both directions. While many thrive during risk-on environments, many also struggle to maintain investor confidence when the ride gets bumpy.

raw.headline: 3 Volatile Stocks Walking a Fine Line
raw.summary: Market swings can be tough to stomach, and volatile stocks often experience exaggerated moves in both directions. While many thrive during risk-on environments, many also struggle to maintain investor confidence when the ride gets bumpy.

headline: Jamie Dimon Reportedly Blasted Brian Armstrong In Davos: 'You Are Full Of...'
summary: Coinbase Global Inc. (NASDAQ:COIN) CEO Brian Armstrong reportedly faced harsh criticism from Wall Street’s biggest bank chiefs at the World Economic Forum in Davos. The Davos Showdown JPMorgan Chase (NYSE:JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon interrupted Armstrong’s coffee meeting with former U.K. Prime Minister Tony Blair to confront him directly according to a Wall Street Journal feature published on Friday. “You are full of s—,” Dimon said with his index finger pointed at Armstrong’s face, telling him to stop
